did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Capital Planning and Development Razed and Inactive Buildings Records
did.abstract: Building plans, architectual drawings, and administrative files related to construction projects related to Martin Stadium and the Intercollegiate Nursing Center (ICNE) at WSU from 1985-2010.

bioghist.p: A University Architect served as the construction officer at Washington State University from 1911 forward. The modern form of the office dates from 1947 when it became a full-time, staffed administrative department. In 1967 the University Architect office was renamed as Facilities Planning, and then to Facilities Development in 1993. In 2001 it was renamed as Capital Planning (later Capital Planning and Development). While Capital Planning is responsible for major planning and development, smaller projects are conducted by Facilities Operations. Facilities Operations descended from the Physical Plant in 1998, which in turn descended from Building and Grounds in 1967. While each line of programs has existed separately, some migration in function has occurred over the years. The primary difference between Capital Planning and Facilities Operations is the cost of the project in question - initially items costing less than $1,000,000 were assigned to Fac Ops, and those costing more to CP. By 2009, this break point is between $1,500,000 and $2,000,000.

scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of drawings, administrative files, and contracts related to construction on the Martin Stadium Tunnel and the Intercollegiate Nursing Center (also known as ICNE) from 1985-2010.
An itemized list of the contents of this collection can be found online here.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.

Material is sorted into clearly labeled subject matter folders. Accession list exists within both boxes. Box 1 contains material on both Martin Stadium and ICNE. Box 2 contains material mostly related to the construction and remodel of the Intercollegiate Nursing Center. Tube holds plans for both the ICNE and Martin Stadium Tunnel.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Capital Planning and Development Razed and Inactive Buildings Records, 1985-2010 (UA2013-06)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Rick Ward of Facilities on April 02, 2013 and retained as UA2013-06.

relatedmaterial.p: Other Nevada St bridge materials are in UA2013-03.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
